definition: to tie on/to buckle up/to fasten
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Please attach labels to all your bags.
sentences.chinese: 请你把所有的包上都系上标签。

sentences.english: Trevor, let me tie your shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 特雷福，让我帮你把鞋带系上吧。

sentences.english: The tourist attached labels to all his bags.
sentences.chinese: 旅游者把他的行李都系上标签。

sentences.english: A tag was attached to each article.
sentences.chinese: 每件物品上都系上了标签。

sentences.english: There is a white ribbon on every branch.
sentences.chinese: 每根树枝都系上了白丝带。

sentences.english: Harnesses are also attached on the riders to allow for a safer travel experience.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车的人也要系上背带，保证骑行时候的安全。

sentences.english: May I tie on your bib?
sentences.chinese: 我可以替您系上围兜吗？

sentences.english: Tie it with fabric bows that co-ordinate with other furnishings.
sentences.chinese: 系上与其他装饰相配的布质蝴蝶结。

sentences.english: Rescue the drowning and tie your shoestrings.
sentences.chinese: 救起淹在水里的人，系上你的鞋带。

sentences.english: We'll need several lengths of string to tie the package.
sentences.chinese: 他用一段绳子把它系上了。

sentences.english: With the strap, the bag can be used as a carry-on.
sentences.chinese: 系上个带子后就可以随身携带了。

sentences.english: Set bird's wings with gold and it will never again soar in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 给鸟翼系上了黄金，它便再也无法翱翔于天空了。

sentences.english: Each animal was tagged with a number for identification.
sentences.chinese: 每只小动物都系上了标有号码的小牌，以便确认。

sentences.english: Hurry up. Tie up your shoelaces; we are late.
sentences.chinese: 快点儿，系上你的鞋带，我们迟到了。

sentences.english: Men usually wore a Dhoti , which is a length of fabric wrapped around the waist.
sentences.chinese: 男人通常是系上腰布，是把一块长布围在腰间。

definition: belt/band/ribbon/strap/girdle/(coll.) audio or video tape/Farrer's scallop (Chlamys farreri)/comb pen shell (Atrina pectinata)
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
